data.Title: DOJ May Break Up Google
data.Description: The US Department of Justice is considering breaking up Google, potentially separating Android, Chrome, and Google Ads.  Other scenarios include forcing Google to share data with competitors.

data.Title: Bing Was Faster Than Google in 2017
data.Description: Internal Google documents from 2017, revealed during the DOJ antitrust trials, acknowledged that Bing Search was faster than Google, particularly for mobile searches.

data.Title: Google Gemini Research to Feature Citations and Website Links
data.Description: Google Gemini Research will soon allow users to research topics and receive citations and links to websites, potentially changing how users interact with search results.

data.Title: Google Hotel Listings Targeted by Hijackers
data.Description: Google hotel listings are being hijacked with fake WhatsApp numbers added and hotels falsely marked as permanently closed.

data.Title: Google Search Console Recommendations Rolling Out
data.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out a new recommendations feature, providing website owners with actionable insights to improve their search performance.

data.Title: Google AI Overviews Volatility Continues
data.Description: Google's AI Overviews continue to fluctuate, with increased overlap in search results and changes in trigger patterns for different industries.

data.Title: Publishers Report Positive Q2 Earnings
data.Description: Publishers are experiencing a strong second quarter in 2024, with AI deals and an improved ad market contributing to positive earnings.

data.Title: Political Ad Spending Favors Connected TV
data.Description: Connected TV (CTV) is emerging as a major beneficiary of political ad spending, with publishers, agencies, and ad tech vendors reporting increased investment.
